description: A decadent no-bake avocado chocolate fudge tart with a pretzel crust and date caramel cream layer on top. This recipe is soy-free and nut-free.

mentions.description: Chocolate /ˈtʃɒkᵊlᵻt/ is a typically sweet, usually brown, food preparation of Theobroma cacao seeds, roasted and ground, often flavored, as with vanilla. It is made in the form of a liquid, paste, or in a block, or used as a flavoring ingredient in other foods. Cacao has been cultivated by many cultures for at least...
mentions.name: chocolate

The course usually consists of sweet foods and beverages, such as dessert wine or liqueurs, but may include coffee, cheeses, nuts, or other savory items. In some parts of the world, such as much of central and western Africa, there is no tradition of a...
mentions.name: sweet dish

name: Avocado Chocolate Fudge Tart with Pretzel Crust and Caramel Cream
recipeIngredient: 6 tbsp coconut sugar (or 4 tbsp brown sugar)
3/4 cup coconut sugar (or 1/2 cup brown sugar)
1 tsp instant coffee or espresso powder
3/4 cup pitted dates (loosely packed, soaked in warm water for 2+ hours)

recipeInstructions.text: Add the pretzel "flour" and coconut oil to a blender or food processor. Pulse several times until the mixture starts to stick.
Add the coconut sugar and half of the nondairy milk. Pulse repeatedly until the sugar is well-combined.
Test the mixture by pinching a bit of it between your fingers to see if it holds together. Add the rest of the nondairy milk if needed, a tablespoon at a time, until it does.
Transfer the mixture into a pie or tart dish. Use your fingers to press it down, and up the sides, in an even layer. Place the dish in the freezer for the crust to set, and wipe out the blender.
